org.bbi.linuxjoy.hacks

Class DummyInterruptibleChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.nio.channels.spi.AbstractInterruptibleChannel
      • org.bbi.linuxjoy.hacks.DummyInterruptibleChannel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.nio.channels.Channel, java.nio.channels.InterruptibleChannel

    public class DummyInterruptibleChannel
extends java.nio.channels.spi.AbstractInterruptibleChannel
    When you need the channel object in LinuxJoystick to not be null and you need an implementation of AbstractInterruptibleChannel! This hack can be used if your implementation of LinuxJoystick channel functions don't actually use a Java NIO channel. In your channelOpen() function you can do something like: fc = new org.bbi.linuxjoy.hacks.DummyInterruptibleChannel(); to prevent it being null (which signifies that the open function failed)
